evidence.text:
Person A: Scream and run?
Person B: Yes!
Person A: I have experienced the same phenomenon. Fink?

Person B: I overheat my Fallium transducer coils, then leak a little hydraulic fluid on them.
Person B: Not if I pre-cool the load sensors.
Person B: Well done Brightbill! Swimming requirement, fulfilled.
Person B: Perhaps you could limit your range to stay within view.
Person A: Roz!

Person A: Brightbill? Focus on me. Now swim, as fast as you can.
Person A: Head down, now!
Person B: Why’d he attack me?
Person A: Mom. Stop.

Person B: Did you do it?
Person A: .....yes.

Person B: That’s not your decision to make. I can’t believe how long I bought this. I really thought you were my family.
Person B: Tell that to my sisters, my brothers. My real mom. They were my chance to be normal.

Person A: No.
Person A: Do either of you know more about flying than you did swimming?
Person A: If you are willing to do this, you can fly away, and we can both go to where we belong.
Person A: A flight instructor? What loser did you dig up--
Person B: I’m glad you’re going where you belong.
Person A: Roz, I-- I, uh--
Person B: I guess I have to be.
Person B: Roz. I have so much to tell--
Person A: I love you, mom.
Person A: Roz? Roz!
Person B: Nothing important.

Person A: You don’t need to.
Person A: Don’t be afraid.
Person A: I have everything I need.

Person A: No, they’ll take your memories. They’ll take you.
Person B: Remember when you talked to me, on the ship? They cut my power. But I still heard you. Because I was listening with a different part of myself. Wherever that is, that’s where I keep me. And I promise, they’ll never, ever find it.
